summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July 2020 between defense attorneys Aaron Mysliwiec and Erica T. Dubno and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss the attorneys' client's continued cooperation with the prosecution, a desire to reconfirm their working relationship following unspecified news events, and an intention to follow up on an unspecified matter.

persons.name: Erica T. Dubno
persons.context: An attorney from the law firm Fahringer & Dubno corresponding with a federal prosecutor about a client's cooperation and case status.

persons.name: Aaron Mysliwiec
persons.context: An attorney corresponding with a federal prosecutor, co-signing emails with Erica Dubno regarding their client's cooperation with the investigation.

events.title: Attorneys Check In Following News Events
events.description: Defense attorneys Aaron Mysliwiec and Erica Dubno email a federal prosecutor to 'reconfirm our continued interest in and efforts to work with your office' in light of unspecified events reported in the news.

locations: 43 West 40 Street Suite 261, New York, New York
keyFacts: Defense attorneys for an unnamed client were in active communication with federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York in mid-2020 regarding their client's cooperation.

The attorneys initiated contact on July 2, 2020, specifically citing 'events that were reported in the news today' as the reason for wanting to reconfirm their working relationship with the prosecution.
The prosecution acknowledged the client's assistance and cooperation and indicated an intention to follow up on an unspecified matter the following week.
The correspondence shows an ongoing, cooperative relationship between the defense and prosecution regarding an investigation, with the defense proactively seeking to maintain it.
